storyTitle: As Approver, I want to perform approval of schedule change requests to achieve timely decision making

testCases.title: Validate display of pending schedule change requests
preconditions: Approver user account exists with valid credentials
Approver has been assigned pending schedule change requests
At least one schedule change request is in pending status
System is accessible and operational
Approver has appropriate role-based permissions

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid approver credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Approver is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard displaying pending approvals within 3 seconds

steps.action: Review the pending approvals dashboard and select a pending schedule change request from the list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Request details page opens showing complete information including requester name, requested changes, reason for change, submission date, and any attached documents or files

steps.action: Review the request details and attachments, enter approval comments in the comments field, and click the Approve button
steps.expectedResult: Request status immediately updates to 'Approved', confirmation message is displayed to the approver, and the request is removed from the pending approvals list

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Approved' in the database
Approval action is logged with timestamp and approver details
Requester receives notification of approval
Request no longer appears in pending approvals dashboard

testCases.title: Verify rejection requires mandatory comments
preconditions: Approver is logged into the system
At least one schedule change request is pending approval
Approver has permissions to reject requests
Validation rules for mandatory comments are configured

steps.action: From the pending approvals dashboard, select a schedule change request and click on it to open details
steps.expectedResult: Request details page is displayed with options to Approve or Reject

steps.action: Click the Reject button without entering any comments in the comments field
steps.expectedResult: Rejection form is displayed with the comment field highlighted, validation error message appears stating 'Comments are required for rejection', and the submission is blocked

steps.action: Enter detailed rejection comments in the comments field explaining the reason for rejection, then click Submit
steps.expectedResult: Request status immediately updates to 'Rejected', confirmation message is displayed, rejection comments are saved, and the request is removed from pending approvals list

postconditions: Schedule change request status is updated to 'Rejected' in the database
Rejection comments are stored with the request
Approval action is logged with timestamp, approver details, and comments
Requester receives notification of rejection with comments

testCases.title: Test multi-level approval routing
preconditions: Multi-level approval workflow is configured in the system
First-level approver account exists and is active
Second-level approver account exists and is active
Schedule change request type requires multi-level approval
Approval routing rules are properly defined

steps.action: Submit a schedule change request that requires multi-level approval through the request submission interface
steps.expectedResult: Request is successfully submitted and automatically routed to the first-level approver, appearing in their pending approvals dashboard with status 'Pending - Level 1 Approval'

steps.action: Log in as the first-level approver, navigate to pending approvals, select the request, enter approval comments, and click Approve
steps.expectedResult: First-level approval is recorded, request status updates to 'Pending - Level 2 Approval', and the request is automatically routed to the second-level approver's pending approvals dashboard

steps.action: Log in as the second-level approver, navigate to pending approvals, select the request, review first-level approval details, enter approval comments, and click Approve
steps.expectedResult: Second-level approval is recorded, request status updates to 'Approved', confirmation message is displayed, and the request is marked as fully approved with all approval levels completed

postconditions: Schedule change request status is 'Approved' with all approval levels completed
Both first-level and second-level approval actions are logged with timestamps
Request no longer appears in any approver's pending list
Requester receives notification of final approval
Audit trail shows complete multi-level approval workflow

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to perform viewing of approval history to achieve audit and compliance tracking

testCases.title: Validate display of approval history for a schedule change request
preconditions: Approver or auditor is logged into the system with valid credentials
At least one schedule change request exists with approval history
Multiple approval actions have been recorded for the request
User has authorized role to view approval history
ApprovalActions table contains historical data

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change requests list and click on a specific schedule change request to open its details page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule change request details page is displayed showing request information, current status, and available tabs including 'Approval History'

steps.action: Click on the 'Approval History' tab on the request details page
steps.expectedResult: Approval history tab loads within 2 seconds displaying a chronological list of all approval actions in reverse chronological order (most recent first)

steps.action: Review each approval action entry in the history list to verify all required information is displayed
steps.expectedResult: Each approval action shows complete details including approver full name, decision (Approved/Rejected), comments entered by approver, and timestamp in readable format (date and time). All data is accurate and matches the recorded approval actions

postconditions: Approval history remains accessible for future reference
No data is modified during the viewing process
User session remains active
Audit log records the history access action

testCases.title: Test export of approval history report
preconditions: User is logged in with authorized role
Schedule change request with approval history exists
User is viewing the approval history tab
PDF export functionality is enabled
User has appropriate permissions to export reports

steps.action: On the approval history tab, locate and click the 'Export to PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF report generation process initiates, progress indicator is displayed, and PDF file is automatically generated and downloaded to the user's default download location

steps.action: Navigate to the download location, locate the exported PDF file, and open it using a PDF reader application
steps.expectedResult: PDF report opens successfully and contains complete approval history details including request information, chronological list of all approval actions with approver names, decisions, comments, timestamps, and proper formatting for readability

postconditions: PDF file is saved in user's download folder
Original approval history data remains unchanged
Export action is logged in audit trail
PDF contains accurate snapshot of approval history at time of export

testCases.title: Verify access control for approval history
preconditions: Role-based access control is configured for approval history
Unauthorized user account exists without approval history permissions
Authorized approver account exists with proper permissions
Schedule change request with approval history exists
Security policies are enforced

steps.action: Log in as an unauthorized user (without approval history access permissions) and attempt to navigate to a schedule change request's approval history tab or directly access the approval history URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied, system displays 'Access Denied' or 'Unauthorized Access' error message, and user is prevented from viewing the approval history. User may be redirected to an error page or their dashboard

steps.action: Log out from the unauthorized user account, then log in as an authorized approver with proper permissions to view approval history
steps.expectedResult: Authorized approver successfully logs in and can navigate to schedule change request details

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule change request details page and click on the 'Approval History' tab
steps.expectedResult: Approval history tab is accessible, loads within 2 seconds, and displays complete chronological approval history with all approval action details visible to the authorized approver

postconditions: Access control policies remain enforced
Unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit trail
Authorized users maintain proper access to approval history
No security vulnerabilities are exposed

storyTitle: As System Administrator, I want to perform configuration of approval workflow rules to achieve flexible and maintainable approval processes

testCases.title: Validate creation and saving of workflow configuration
preconditions: User is logged in with System Administrator role
WorkflowConfigurations table is accessible
API endpoints GET/POST /api/workflow-configurations are operational
At least one approver role and user exist in the system

steps.action: System Administrator navigates to workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Configuration UI is displayed with options to create new workflow, view existing workflows, and configuration form fields

steps.action: Click 'Create New Workflow' button
steps.expectedResult: New workflow configuration form is displayed with empty fields for workflow name, approvers, approval levels, and routing rules

steps.action: Enter workflow name, select approver roles and users, define multi-level approval sequence, and set routing rules
steps.expectedResult: All entered data is accepted and displayed correctly in the form fields without validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to save the workflow configuration
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and workflow appears in the list with 'Inactive' status

steps.action: Select the saved workflow from the list and click 'Activate' button
steps.expectedResult: Workflow status changes to 'Active', activation confirmation message is displayed, and configuration is applied to the system

steps.action: Wait for 5 minutes and verify workflow is operational
steps.expectedResult: Workflow configuration changes are propagated and the workflow is fully active and ready to process approval requests

postconditions: New workflow configuration is saved in WorkflowConfigurations table
Workflow status is set to 'Active'
Configuration is applied and operational within 5 minutes
Workflow is available for processing approval requests

testCases.title: Verify validation prevents invalid configurations
preconditions: User is logged in with System Administrator role
Workflow configuration page is accessible
Validation rules are configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to workflow configuration page and click 'Create New Workflow'
steps.expectedResult: New workflow configuration form is displayed

steps.action: Enter workflow name but leave approver roles and users fields empty
steps.expectedResult: Form accepts the partial input without immediate validation

steps.action: Click 'Save' button with incomplete configuration
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors are displayed indicating required fields: 'Approver roles required', 'At least one approver user must be selected', save operation is blocked

steps.action: Add approvers but create conflicting routing rules (e.g., circular dependencies or contradictory conditions)
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors are displayed indicating conflicting rules with specific details about the conflict, save operation is blocked

steps.action: Correct all validation errors by filling required fields and resolving conflicting routing rules
steps.expectedResult: Validation errors disappear as corrections are made, form shows no validation errors

steps.action: Click 'Save' button with corrected configuration
steps.expectedResult: Configuration is saved successfully, confirmation message is displayed, and workflow appears in the list

postconditions: Valid workflow configuration is saved in the system
Invalid configurations are prevented from being saved
Validation messages guide administrator to correct errors

testCases.title: Test access restriction to workflow configuration
preconditions: Two user accounts exist: one with Admin role and one with non-admin role (e.g., Approver or Employee)
Workflow configuration page URL is known
Security role validation is enabled

steps.action: Log in to the system using non-admin user credentials
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged in and redirected to their default dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to workflow configuration page by entering URL directly or through navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Access denied message is displayed: 'You do not have permission to access this page. Admin role required.' User is not able to view or access the configuration page

steps.action: Log out from non-admin user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in to the system using Admin user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Admin user is successfully logged in and redirected to admin dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to workflow configuration page
steps.expectedResult: Full access is granted, workflow configuration page is displayed with all configuration options, create/edit/delete capabilities are available

steps.action: Verify all workflow configuration features are accessible (view, create, edit, activate, deactivate)
steps.expectedResult: All workflow configuration features are fully functional and accessible to the Admin user

postconditions: Non-admin users remain restricted from workflow configuration access
Admin users have full access to workflow configuration
Security role validation is confirmed working correctly

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to perform filtering and searching of schedule change requests to achieve efficient workload management

testCases.title: Validate filtering by status and date range
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Multiple schedule change requests exist with various statuses (Pending, Approved, Rejected)
Schedule change requests exist with submission dates spanning more than 7 days
Approver has authorization to view the test schedule change requests
Pending approvals dashboard is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed showing all pending schedule change requests assigned to the approver without any filters applied

steps.action: Locate and click on the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter dropdown opens showing available status options: All, Pending, Approved, Rejected

steps.action: Select 'Pending' from the status filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Status filter is applied, dropdown shows 'Pending' as selected

steps.action: Locate and click on the date range filter, select 'Last 7 days' option
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter is applied showing 'Last 7 days', date range displays current date minus 7 days to current date

steps.action: Click 'Apply Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list is displayed within 2 seconds showing only schedule change requests with status 'Pending' submitted within the last 7 days, request count is updated to reflect filtered results

steps.action: Verify each displayed request matches the filter criteria by checking status and submission date
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests have status 'Pending' and submission dates within the last 7 days

steps.action: Click 'Clear Filters' button
steps.expectedResult: All filters are removed, full list of pending approvals assigned to the approver is displayed, filter controls reset to default state

postconditions: Filters are cleared and system returns to unfiltered view
Filter functionality is confirmed working correctly
No data is modified during the test

testCases.title: Test keyword search functionality
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Multiple schedule change requests exist with varying details and descriptions
At least one request contains a known unique keyword in its details
Search functionality is enabled on pending approvals dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed with search box visible and full list of pending schedule change requests

steps.action: Locate the keyword search input field
steps.expectedResult: Search input field is visible and active, placeholder text indicates 'Search requests...'

steps.action: Enter a keyword that is known to exist in at least one request's details (e.g., 'vacation', 'emergency', or specific employee name)
steps.expectedResult: Keyword is entered in the search field and displayed correctly

steps.action: Press Enter or click 'Search' button
steps.expectedResult: Search is executed within 2 seconds, list is filtered to show only requests containing the entered keyword in their details, matching keyword is highlighted in the results

steps.action: Verify that all displayed requests contain the searched keyword in their details
steps.expectedResult: All displayed requests contain the keyword in request title, description, or other detail fields

steps.action: Clear the search field and enter a keyword that does not exist in any request (e.g., 'xyzabc123nonexistent')
steps.expectedResult: Non-existent keyword is entered in the search field

steps.action: Press Enter or click 'Search' button
steps.expectedResult: Search is executed within 2 seconds, no results are displayed, message 'No schedule change requests found matching your search criteria' is shown

steps.action: Clear the search field
steps.expectedResult: Search is cleared, full list of pending approvals is restored and displayed

postconditions: Search field is cleared
Full unfiltered list is displayed
Search functionality is confirmed working for both existing and non-existing keywords

testCases.title: Verify sorting of filtered results
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
Multiple schedule change requests exist with different submission dates and priority levels
At least 5 requests are available for meaningful sorting verification
Requests have varied submission dates and priority values (High, Medium, Low)
Pending approvals dashboard is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to pending approvals dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard is displayed with list of schedule change requests in default sort order

steps.action: Apply any filter (e.g., status 'Pending') to create a filtered result set
steps.expectedResult: Filtered list is displayed showing only pending requests

steps.action: Locate the 'Submission Date' column header and click to sort descending
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator (down arrow) appears on Submission Date column header, requests are reordered from newest to oldest submission date

steps.action: Verify the order by checking submission dates of first and last visible requests
steps.expectedResult: First request has the most recent submission date, last request has the oldest submission date, all requests are in descending chronological order

steps.action: Click on 'Submission Date' column header again to toggle sort to ascending
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator changes to up arrow, requests are reordered from oldest to newest submission date

steps.action: Locate the 'Priority' column header and click to sort ascending
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator (up arrow) appears on Priority column header, requests are reordered from lowest to highest priority (Low, Medium, High)

steps.action: Verify the order by checking priority values of displayed requests
steps.expectedResult: Requests are ordered with Low priority first, followed by Medium, then High priority requests last, all requests maintain the filtered criteria while being sorted

steps.action: Click on 'Priority' column header again to toggle sort to descending
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator changes to down arrow, requests are reordered from highest to lowest priority (High, Medium, Low)

postconditions: Filtered results remain filtered while sorting is applied
Sort functionality works correctly for both submission date and priority columns
No data is modified during sorting operations

storyTitle: As Approver, I want to perform delegation of approval tasks to achieve workload distribution

testCases.title: Validate creation of approval delegation
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
At least one qualified delegate user exists in the system
Approver has pending approval tasks assigned
Delegations table is accessible and operational
API endpoint POST /api/delegations is available

steps.action: Navigate to the delegation settings page from the approver dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Delegation UI is displayed with options to create new delegation, showing delegate selection dropdown and date range fields

steps.action: Click on the delegate user dropdown and select a qualified user from the list
steps.expectedResult: Selected delegate user is highlighted and displayed in the delegate field

steps.action: Set the delegation start date to current date using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Start date is populated with the selected date in the correct format

steps.action: Set the delegation end date to a future date (e.g., 7 days from current date) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: End date is populated with the selected date and is after the start date

steps.action: Click the 'Save Delegation' or 'Create Delegation' button
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming delegation has been saved successfully, and delegation appears in the active delegations list

steps.action: Log out from the Approver account and log in with the delegate user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Delegate user is successfully logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the approvals or tasks section as the delegate user
steps.expectedResult: Delegate can see and access the delegated approval tasks that were originally assigned to the Approver, with clear indication that these are delegated tasks

postconditions: Delegation is active and stored in the Delegations table
Delegate user has access to the Approver's pending approval tasks
Approver can view the active delegation in their delegation settings
Delegation action is logged in the audit log with timestamp and user details

testCases.title: Test revocation of delegation
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
An active delegation exists that was created by the Approver
Delegate user currently has access to delegated approval tasks
API endpoint for delegation management is available

steps.action: Navigate to the delegation settings page from the approver dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Delegation UI is displayed showing the list of active delegations

steps.action: Locate the active delegation in the delegations list and identify the revoke option (button or link)
steps.expectedResult: Active delegation is visible with delegate name, date range, and a 'Revoke' or 'Cancel' button

steps.action: Click the 'Revoke Delegation' button for the active delegation
steps.expectedResult: System displays a confirmation dialog asking to confirm the revocation action

steps.action: Confirm the revocation by clicking 'Yes' or 'Confirm' in the confirmation dialog
steps.expectedResult: System displays success message confirming delegation has been revoked, and the delegation is removed from the active delegations list or marked as revoked

steps.action: Log out from the Approver account and log in with the delegate user credentials
steps.expectedResult: Delegate user is successfully logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the approvals or tasks section as the delegate user
steps.expectedResult: Delegate can no longer see or access the previously delegated approval tasks; the tasks are no longer assigned to the delegate

steps.action: Log back in as the Approver and verify the approval tasks are back in the Approver's queue
steps.expectedResult: Approval tasks are visible in the Approver's pending tasks list and are no longer delegated

postconditions: Delegation is revoked and no longer active
Delegate user no longer has access to the previously delegated approval tasks
Approval tasks are returned to the original Approver
Revocation action is logged in the audit log with timestamp and user details

testCases.title: Verify audit logging of delegation actions
preconditions: User is logged in with Approver role
At least one qualified delegate user exists in the system
Audit logging system is enabled and operational
User has permissions to view audit logs or access to audit log reports
API endpoints for delegation and audit logs are available

steps.action: Navigate to the delegation settings page and create a new delegation by selecting a delegate user and setting start and end dates
steps.expectedResult: Delegation is created successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Click 'Save Delegation' to complete the delegation creation
steps.expectedResult: System saves the delegation and displays it in the active delegations list

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log section or access audit log reports
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface is displayed with search and filter options

steps.action: Search or filter audit logs for delegation creation actions by the current Approver user
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays an entry for the delegation creation action with details including: action type (Delegation Created), Approver username, delegate username, timestamp, start date, and end date

steps.action: Return to the delegation settings page and revoke the previously created delegation
steps.expectedResult: Delegation is revoked successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate back to the audit log section and refresh or search for recent delegation actions
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface displays updated entries including the revocation action

steps.action: Search or filter audit logs for delegation revocation actions by the current Approver user
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays an entry for the delegation revocation action with details including: action type (Delegation Revoked), Approver username, delegate username, revocation timestamp, and original delegation details

steps.action: Verify that both audit log entries (creation and revocation) contain accurate timestamps in chronological order
steps.expectedResult: Both audit log entries are present with accurate timestamps showing creation occurred before revocation, and all user details are correctly recorded

postconditions: Audit log contains complete record of delegation creation with all required details
Audit log contains complete record of delegation revocation with all required details
All delegation actions are traceable with user identification and timestamps
Audit trail demonstrates 100% logging of delegation actions as per success metrics
